metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29869 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
cifs-utils through 6.14, with verbose logging, can cause an information leak when a file contains = (equal sign) characters but is not a valid credentials file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-29869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cifs-utils - 2:6.11-3.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cifs-utils package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:6.11-3.1ubuntu0.1').
